drug.drug_name: Procedure: Transoral endoscopic thyroidectomy vestibular approach (TOETVA)

long_title: A Prospective Trial Comparing Transoral Endoscopic Thyroidectomy Vestibular Approach (TOETVA) and Conventional Open Thyroidectomy
principal_investigator_institution: Department of Otorhinolaryngology, Head and Neck Surgery, The Chinese University of Hong Kong
prior_treatment_requirements: * Suspicious malignant thyroid nodule less than 2cm, suitable for transoral endoscopic surgery
Exclude - * Vulnerable population (e.g. Cognitive impairment, pregnant)
Exclude - * Previous radiotherapy at the head and neck region
Exclude - * Presence of another malignancy, lateral neck, or distant metastasis
Exclude - * Cervical spine disease precluding extension of the neck
Exclude - * Severe concomitant illness that drastically shortens life expectancy or increases risk of therapeutic intervention
short_title: A Prospective Trial Comparing Transoral Endoscopic Thyroidectomy Vestibular Approach (TOETVA) and Conventional Open Thyroidectomy

sponsor.sponsor_name: Tseung Kwan O Hospital, Hong Kong

summary: To determine if transoral endoscopic thyroidectomy vestibular approach (TOETVA) is a safe and effective procedure compared to traditional open thyroidectomy. Surgical outcomes, patients' satisfaction, voice and swallowing outcomes will be assessed.

arm.arm_description: Test group receiving surgery under transoral endoscopic thyroidectomy vestibular approach (TOETVA)

dose_level.level_description: Procedure: Transoral endoscopic thyroidectomy vestibular approach (TOETVA)

arm.arm_description: Control group receiving traditional open thyroidectomy
